intro: Cypholepis, commonly known as the African hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It comprises about 25 species, predominantly found in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees with simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Many species produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, and some have hairy or glandular surfaces. Cypholepis species are often used in traditional medicine and for ornamental purposes due to their attractive flowers and hardy nature.
